answers.answer: Lilah,We here at Medhelp are volunteers, not medical professionals.  We provide our insight and opinion based on our life experiences with type 1 diabetes.  What I can advise is that your boyfriend needs to be seen by a medical professional to have his blood evaluated, especially if he was already advised by his physician to do so.  It could have very well have been a hypoclygenic incident, but he needs a medical professional to determine what caused his symptoms.  I hope that you can convince him to do the sensible thing and get to a doctor.  Maybe he is afraid, but he is probably more afraid not knowing what is going on that what it could possibly be.  Good luck and if we can help out here, please visit again.

question: im worried about my boyfriendhe recently told me that his doctor did a urine test and there was glucose in his urine and he was told he could be diabetic.i dont know why but he is very reluctant to go back to his doctor and have a second test (which is what his doctor told him to do)a few weeks ago he was staying at my house overnight and he said he felt bad.he had a headache and started shivering/shaking/trembling and felt very weak. he could not get to sleep and was quite distressed. i didnt know what to do.he insists he was overtired. it lasted a few hours. but i am concerned that it may have been a hypo.could it have been that?im worried about him :(lilahx
title: did my bf have a hypo?
